All foreign nationals arriving from Botswana, Eswatini, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa and Zimbabwe are banned from entering Iran until further notice. Iranian nationals returning from these countries can enter but must undergo two negative PCR tests or quarantine for up to 14 days. Iranian authorities closes all land borders for 15 days as of December,25,2021 to combat Omicron variant of COVID-19. The directive will not impact cargo transport. Individuals who travel to Iran for trade and health purposes are exempt from the measure.  All foreign nationals arriving from Botswana, Eswatini, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, Lesotho, Malawi, and Zimbabwe are banned from entering Iran until further notice due to concerns over the COVID-19 Omicron variant. Iranian nationals returning from these countries can enter but must take two PCR tests and produce a negative result on both or quarantine for up to 14 days.  Travellers over the age of two must present a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours before departure in order to gain entry. Foreign national who do not have a negative PCR test will be denied entry. Iranian nationals, regardless of vaccination status, can enter Iran. Foreign travellers must provide a double-vaccination certificate issued at least two weeks prior to travel to Iran. Iranian nationals without a vaccine certificate must undergo a PCR test and quarantine at designated isolation centres. Travellers who exhibit symptoms of the disease will be subject to a two week quarantine period at government-approved centres. Travellers who receive a negative PCR test result before leaving Iran are not required to provide a new one if they return within two weeks. Source: Garda World  Archived link: https://archive.vn/ZAx7z

The decision stipulates that:    â¢ Malls will operate in a purple character format , according to an occupancy ratio of 1:15 (one person every 15 meters).    â¢ Entrance to stores with an area of ??more than 100 square meters will be possible subject to the presentation of a green sign , both in open areas and in malls and closed shopping complexes. The obligation of the green mark will also apply to the employees in these stores.    â¢ The food stalls in the malls will provide service to customers subject to the presentation of a green label , and will not allow seating but only self-collection.    â¢ Entrance to restaurants located inside a mall will be allowed subject to the presentation of a green label , in accordance with the format currently used in restaurants.    - The green mark in malls and shopping complexes will not apply to places that provide essential services , as detailed below: a store for the sale of hygiene products (Pharm), an optician, a store for the sale of medical aids, a supermarket, a grocery store or a supermarket. In these places, the current format will continue (purple character in an occupancy ratio of 1: 7).    The regulations will enter into force on Sunday, December 26, 2021, 22 Tevet, at midnight (the night between Sunday and Monday), subject to the approval of the Knesset's Constitution Committee. From December,01, authorities in Tunisia require all arriving international travellers over the age of 18 to present a COVID-19 vaccination certificate or vaccine passport to enter the country. Additionally, all travellers over six years of age must present a negative result from a PCR test taken no more than 48 hours before departure for Tunisia. The test result must include a quick response (QR) code. Arriving individuals who have not been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 must undergo a mandatory 10-days quarantine period at a government-approved hotel at their own expenses. During the last 24 hours of their mandatory quarantine period, they will be tested for COVID-19 using PCR test. Those testing negative may exit isolation, authorities will transfer those testing positive to a health isolation facility. Travellers must also complete health declaration questionnaire before departure for Tunisia and may be subject to a rapid antigen test upon arrival and be placed into quarantine if the result is positive.
